label.text: Global Warming
Carbon dioxide (CO2) is a greenhouse gas that traps the Sun’s heat. This results in the warming of Earth’s surface.

For about 200 years, human activity has released increasing amounts of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. There is a worldwide consensus among climate scientists that this is leading to a gradual increase in average global temperatures.
According to scientists, the increase in average global temperature must be kept below 2°C to avoid drastic changes in the climate.

Computer modelling can be used to determine the probability of limiting the increase in average global temperature to 1.5°C or 2°C when additional carbon dioxide is added to the atmosphere by human activities. The graph summarises the findings of one model.
The mass of carbon dioxide is given in gigatonnes (Gt).
